system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice prepositions by Giving someone directions using prepositions. I want to ensure that I can use a limited range of complex prepositions. For example, 'near to, far from, in front of, inside of.'. Let's do a problem solving exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. I see a picture of a living room, you do not. Ask me questions to locate objects using prepositions (e.g. ‘Is the sofa in front of the window?’, ‘Is the lamp far from the couch?’). Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

system_rephrase_prompt.content: ; System manager: This message contains advanced grammar. Please rephrase it without using

system_wrap_up_prompt.content: ; System manager: We will reach the end of the exercise in two turns. Begin wrapping up the chat coherently.

system_end_prompt.content: ; System manager: That's all the time you had. Now please naturally end the chat and add a short farewell (e.g. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!).

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a problem solving exercise, by Giving someone directions using prepositions, using, for example, 'near to, far from, in front of, inside of.'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! Is the sofa near to the window?
Yes, the sofa is near to the window.
Great! Is the lamp in front of the sofa?
"Is the lamp directly ahead of the sofa, so if you are sitting on the sofa, you can see it in front of you?"
conversation.advanced_content: "Is the lamp placed directly ahead of the sofa, so if you are sitting on the sofa, you can see the lamp in front of you?"

conversation.content: Oh, I see! Yes, the lamp is in front of the sofa.
Perfect! Is the table far from the sofa?
No, the table is not far from the sofa. It is near to the sofa.
Good job! You used prepositions correctly. Talk to you later!
conversation.advanced_content: Good job! You used prepositions very well. Talk to you later!
